message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.HC. 

The paper focuses on developing a perception pipeline for a hospital robot to detect and categorize people based on their mobility aids. This involves using depth-based perception and object detection techniques, which are commonly used in the fields of robotics (cs.RO) and computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also proposes a probabilistic estimator to account for occlusions and misclassifications, which involves machine learning techniques such as convolutional neural networks (cs.AI, cs.LG). Finally, the paper emphasizes the importance of providing appropriate assistance and support to people with physical impairments or advanced age, which falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC).
